labels.analysis: The Taskeract Server is designed to enhance productivity for developers by integrating task management directly into their code editor environment. It provides tools to retrieve project tasks, manage task statuses, and maintain synchronization between the integrated development environment (IDE) and task workflows. The core functionality revolves around task tracking, status management, and stakeholder requirement integration within the development workflow.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Development Tools" was chosen because the server directly supports development workflows by managing tasks within the IDE. The secondary label "Daily Productivity" was selected because the tool enhances efficiency in developer task management. The secondary label "Database Operations" is considered relevant due to the tasks likely being managed in a database backend. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Taskeract Server
server_info_crawled.author: @Acqusys/taskeract-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable your AI-powered code editor to seamlessly interact with the Taskeract platform, providing full context of your active tasks. Streamline task management by integrating stakeholder requirements directly into your development environment. Enhance productivity by keeping your IDE synchronized with organized, AI-driven task workflows.

tools.name: get-my-projects
tools.description: Deploy Server Taskeract Server @Acqusys/taskeract-mcp Try in Playground get-my-projects

tools.name: get-my-tasks-for-project
tools.description: Get user's tasks for the project by project ID

tools.name: start-on-task
tools.description: This will change the status of the task to "in progress" and return information about the task, the story it is part of, and the feature it is part of, and the project it is part of.

tools.name: task-is-ready-for-review
tools.description: This will change the status of the task to "in review", and the user can then decide on the next task to work on.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@Acqusys/taskeract-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: taskeractApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Taskeract API key for authenticating to the Taskeract platform
